label: logicA:chemistry_en
steps: [1] If a primary alcohol is oxidized under these conditions, an aldehyde forms.
[2] If an aldehyde is exposed to excess oxidant, a carboxylic acid results.
[3] For any species x, if x is a Lewis acid, then x accepts an electron pair from a Lewis base.
[4] Aluminum chloride (AlCl3) is a Lewis acid.
[5] A primary alcohol in the sample is subjected to these oxidizing conditions.
[6] Therefore an aldehyde forms from the primary alcohol (from [1] and [5]).
[7] Therefore a carboxylic acid forms from that aldehyde (from [2] and [6]).
[8] Therefore AlCl3 accepts an electron pair from a Lewis base (from [3] and [4]).
[9] Consequently, a carboxylic acid is obtained and AlCl3 accepts an electron pair (from [7] and [8]).
